data.title: Dogs will kill each other if attacking infantry at same time, only one dog remains alive
data.body: If you press 2 or more dogs to attack an infantry unit at same time, and all the dogs jump at same time, there will be only 1 dog left, rest of the dogs are magically vanished from existence.

data.title: NUnit integration
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3268

data.title: Added soviet 01 to the Red Alert campaign
data.body: I added all cut scenes mentioned in the original scu01ea.ini file. The C# scripted version left several out. Fixed all the bit rot with auto upgrade rules and lot's of manual tweaking. Condensed the rules to make them easier to understand and more robust. Added the flare that is presented in the cut scene. You will note that I made this a little less scripted. Compared to the original the yaks don't just appear, you have to build them yourself. The paradrops are manual. In summary this should be a gentle modernization.

data.title: Ported mission GDI03 to the new Lua API
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6786, https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6769 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6762.

data.title: Fixed broken triggers on monster-tank-madness
data.body: Caused by #6747 .

data.title: Moved the crash monitors outside of the game executables
data.body: This is essentially https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6759. I just adjusted https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/commit/595ef07476ad7d865eb80419322a708eb9d4bb53 to not install files that are going to be removed sooner in the first place as I suggested. My hope is that it makes the twisted packaging scripts a little easier to understand.

data.title: Funpark Take #2
data.body:
So i finally have something that resembles a working mission, would like peoples opinions and testing. Will need some small changes before its merged.

Unrelated i have some issues with our current TD balancing one of which is that i think the vehicles are too fast, so i may open  a pr for that next.

data.title: Ship the new utility.cmd script on Windows
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6764 and taking the criticism of @MicroJOo into account that this isn't easy to spot by adding it to the start menu.

data.title: Update OSX app icon.
data.body:
This updates our OSX icon artwork to use the newer svg logo instead of the (poorly rescaled) original logo.

The .iconset is the source artwork package that is converted to the icns using `iconutil`.

data.title: Fixed RepairBridgeOrderTargeter & hut logic - it now ignores dangling bridges
data.body: RepairBridgeOrderTargeter now ignores dangling bridges & rejects bridges under repair.

data.title: Fix the handling of maps with invalid rules.
data.body: Fixes #6787.  This appears to have been regressed by the color validator changes (which access the map rules directly).

data.title: Skirmish Game crashes with "Cannot locate type: IronCurtainableInfo"
data.body:
Hey everone,

My game crashes pretty often when I try to start a Skirmish game. The local server is then not responding until I load another mod, start a Skirmish game (game lobby dialog) and switch to the RA mod again.

I have to do so, because even reboot of the computer or restart of OpenRA itself doesn't fix the Connection Failed error. I _have_ to reload the Mod.

Screenshot of the message that occurs every time until reloading the Mod afterwards:
http://i.imgur.com/bCcNEnT.png

I assume that the exception.log contains the error that was thrown? If so, here's the output:

``` bash
Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20141012
Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.13.0.37)
Runtime Version: Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-4ubuntu1) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Cannot locate type: IronCurtainableInfo
  at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.<MissingTypeAction>m__5 (System.String s) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateObject[ITraitInfo] (System.String className, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateObject[ITraitInfo] (System.String className) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.CreateObject[ITraitInfo] (System.String name) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ActorInfo.LoadTraitInfo (System.String traitName, OpenRA.MiniYaml my) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ActorInfo..ctor (System.String name, OpenRA.MiniYaml node, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 allUnits) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.RulesetCache.<LoadMapRules>m__0 (OpenRA.MiniYamlNode k, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 y) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.RulesetCache+<LoadYamlRules>c__AnonStorey1`1[OpenRA.ActorInfo].<>m__0 (OpenRA.MiniYamlNode wkv, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 wyy) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.RulesetCache+<LoadYamlRules>c__AnonStorey1`1[OpenRA.ActorInfo].<>m__1 (OpenRA.MiniYamlNode kv) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Exts.ToDictionaryWithConflictLog[MiniYamlNode,String,ActorInfo] (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Func`2 keySelector, System.Func`2 elementSelector, System.String debugName, System.Func`2 logKey, System.Func`2 logValue) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.RulesetCache.LoadYamlRules[ActorInfo] (System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 itemCache, System.String[] files, System.Collections.Generic.List`1 nodes, System.Func`3 f) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.RulesetCache.LoadMapRules (OpenRA.Map map) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Map.<PostInit>m__3 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Lazy`1[OpenRA.Ruleset].InitValue () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

data.title: Retire legacy Lua API and IRC code.
data.body:
Our new Lua API has now grown up enough to supersede the old API.  The IRC code hasn't seen any work in the last year, and it may make sense to delegate this responsibility to a thirdparty library such as [SmartIrc4net](https://github.com/meebey/SmartIrc4net) if somebody wants to resume work on the global chat.

Test packages: [OSX](http://build.openra.net/removetest/OpenRA-test-20141019.zip), [Windows](http://build.openra.net/removetest/OpenRA-test-20141019.exe), [deb](http://build.openra.net/removetest/openra_test.20141019_all.deb), [rpm](http://build.openra.net/removetest/openra-test.20141019-1.noarch.rpm), [pkgbuild](http://build.openra.net/removetest/openra-test.20141019-1-any.pkg.tar.xz).

data.title: Renamed RenderInfantry to RenderUnitAnimated
data.body: All the problematic inf-only stuff (death animation, death sounds) has been moved out into separate traits, and this trait is already used by TS shp mechs, for example, so we might as well rename it to make clear that this can be used for any animated unit by now.

data.title: TD menu desaturation does not animate for paused replays
data.body:
This appears to be a fairly old bug.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Load a replay.
2. Pause the replay.
3. Open the menu.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5378530-td-menu-desaturation-does-not-animate-for-paused-replays?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Update shipped map UIDs
data.body:
The output formatting of yaml arrays was changed quite some time ago, which affected the contents of all our map.yamls (and so also their UIDs).  We have avoided committing any of these changes as part of other prs that introduced map rule changes, as per our policy for avoiding unrelated changes in prs.

This has lead to two issues:
- There is a lot of noise to sort through and discard when running the rule updater.
- The maps on the resource site were recently updated (including these formatting changes), which has left them out of sync with what we ship.  This will be the reason for http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=16784 and the many missing maps on http://www.openra.net/games/.

This pr includes the result of opening and resaving all of our shipped maps.  It also includes a fix for mission maps (which otherwise lose their PreviewVideo key), and trailing newlines in some of the mod rules.

data.title: Fixed Lua 5.1 library detection failed on Gentoo and derivatives
data.body: as discussed in #6529.

data.title: WSA file format support
data.body:
Instead of the laborious workaround to create static splash screens https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Mapping#creating-previews-from-the-td-campaign-maps we could add support for http://dune2.ben.savoch.net/formats/wsa/ and play that animation in the mission select window. That will also keep our source code repository clean from binary files and make the release download smaller again.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5373166-wsa-file-format-support?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: D2K: Implement automatic Carryall
data.body:
This is a big WIP, the basic is working and wanted to share this with you guys. Please do not merge yet.

Its buildable from a heavy factory and is transporting harvs to and from procs. For this I've added some hooks into the harvester code.

Before merge i've got this todo list, in my order of preference:
- [x] Carry harvesters to and from spice fields
- [x] Show the unit being carried below the carryall (Needs good polish)
- [x] Base fly when idle (easy)
- [x] Code style and rules yaml

Later in other pr:
- Spawn outside screen and move into playing area after being build
- Transport units to the repair pad when clicked with the wrench
- Deliver a harvester when proc is build
- Show the upward pointing arrow on a selected carryable waiting to be picked up
- Fly more like a Dune2000 caryall rather than like a ra helicopter

data.title: Option to Enable/Disable UI ingame or in replay viewer for purdy screenshots.
data.body:
Title says it all :) Clean screenshots of the battlefield should be possible for us supporting plebs so that we may deliver more glory points to OpenRA.

It would be nice to have a hotkey assigned to turn the UI on and off during games and/or during replays. Perhaps an obscure hotkey as not to accidentally hit it during play.

data.title: Added InfiltrateToUpgrade
data.body: This includes a temporary test example - spies infiltrating vehicles and base defenses to disable them for 30 seconds.

data.title: Unit Testing
Improve new-lua error handling.
data.body:
This improves our handling of lua errors by
1. not crashing inside most of our recent triggers
2. writing the error details (and also print statements) to lua.log
3. halting the game on error with a (rudimentary) dialog.

The error dialog UI isn't great, but this will be difficult to improve without completely rewriting our info-panel implementation.  That is something that needs to be done, but I would prefer to leave that until after the pending release so that it can also include #2850.

Note that #6552 and #6762 include new triggers that will also need to be updated with these fixes.

data.title: Fix smoke animation offset in TD and RA.
data.body: This moves the origin of the smoke to the center of the sprite.  A simple polish fix that we should have done years ago.

data.title: GDI01 and GDI02 fixes
data.body:
- moved down the landing craft unload waypoint by 1 cell (on both missions), matching the original
- disable concrete wall on gdi02
- fix Nod harvester not harvesting by increasing scan radiuses on gdi02
- increased delay for jeep reinforcement in gdi02 to 2 minutes, there's no need to make it arrive this early and as far as I remember it took longer in the original as well.

data.title: Radar + sufficient power = no minimap
data.body:
First time I got this : I have a radar and sufficient power but no minimap.
Something happened between 20 min and 26 min when I lost the minimap (I saw it before).
I watched the replay in order to find low power / Tanya / spy or something like that but I found nothing.
Replay : http://kzsq23rvwy.1fichier.com/.
![noradar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4684572/e77b0ed0-5631-11e4-9eca-834622830bac.png)

data.title: Fixed RenderGunboat wake animation
data.body:
There was a white pixel in the wake animation that has bugged me for quite some time. Upon closer inspection, it turned out that the white pixel was standing still because the wake animation was only played once instead of looping.

The white stands out in an annoying way even on the looping animation though, so I fixed the art as well.

Just watch the shellmap or play the first GDI mission with and without this, you should see the difference.

data.title: Allow adding multiple infantry units on same block and display them in formation?
data.body:
Currently you can only place 1 infantry unit per one block. It's a bit silly looking if you want to place many infantry units on the map.

Wouldn't it be cool if you could add 5 in one block and the game would render them as they would be rendered normally when many infantry units are in same block?

Here could be suggested formations for all 5 amounts:

1:

```

  x 

```

2:

```
x   

   x
```

3:

```
x   
  x 
    x
```

4:

```
x   x

x   x
```

5:

```
x   x
  x 
x   x
```

data.title: Passengers can provide upgrade(s) to transport
Fix HQ rules in nod03a and nod03b.
data.body:
Fixes a bug reported in the website comments:

> There's a bug in missions "sudanese prison break". you can build a comm center but you can't sell it. however you can sell any other building.

The `HQ.NOAIRSTRIKE` definitions did not inherit from the building default, and so they were missing some of the default traits.  This building duplication is no longer necessary, so I have changed this back to using the default HQ with overrides to disable the airstrike.
